intro: Gravesia onivensis, commonly known as the cloud forest grave'sia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
